**Python-tripal Overview**
Python-tripal provides several tools allowing to load data into a remote Chado-based Tripal database. The tripal_rest_api Tripal module must be installed on the remote server to use these tools.

**Useful Links**
`Tripal project website <http://tripal.info/>`_
`Tripal REST API module <http://github.com/abretaud/tripal_rest_api>`_: a Tripal module required to use these galaxy tools

TRIPAILLE_GLOBAL_CONFIG_PATH='.auth.yml'

param.name: wait_for
param.label: Run this only after the following dataset is ready
param.help: Use this if you want to delay the job execution until some data is already loaded. The selected dataset will not be used for anything else.

param.name: program
param.label: Program name [mandatory]
param.help: Name of the program that was used to perform this analysis

param.name: program_version
param.label: Program version [mandatory]
param.help: Version of the program that was used to perform this analysis

param.name: source_uri
param.label: Source URI
param.help: URI where source data was retrieved

param.name: algorithm
param.label: Algorithm
param.help: Algorithm of the program that was used to perform this analysis

param.name: rel_subject_re
param.label: Regular expression to extract the unique name of the parent feature
param.help: this regex will be applied on the fasta definition line to generate the unique name of the parent feature

param.name: rel_subject_type
param.label: Sequence type of the parent
param.help: this should be a Sequence Ontology term

param.name: match_type
param.label: Match type for already loaded features

param.name: query_type
param.label: The feature type of the blast query
param.help: It must be a valid Sequence Ontology term. e.g. 'contig', 'gene', 'mRNA', 'polypeptide'

param.name: query_uniquename
param.label: Find blast query features using their Unique name
param.help: Feature name will be used otherwise

param.name: query_re
param.label: Regular expression to extract the feature name from the blast query name
param.help: leave empty if the first word in query name is sufficient
